1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}

3-- | Gadgets.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Gadget
6  ( ropsGadget,
7    -- * contents
8    consContents, relmapContents,
9    -- * partial-order
10    consPoHeight,
11    consPoDepth,
12    relmapPoScale, relkitPoScale,
13    -- * visit-distance
14    consVisitDistance, relmapVisitDistance,
15    -- * size
16    consSize, relmapSize, relkitSize,
17    -- * eqlize
18    consEqlize, relmapEqlize, relkitEqlize,
19    -- * dump-tree
20    consDumpTree,
21  ) where
22
23import qualified Data.Map.Strict                   as Map
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture          as O
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base              as B
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax            as S
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data              as D
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core              as C
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base          as Rop
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.PoScale  as Rop
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Subtext  as Rop
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message  as Msg
33
34
35-- | Gadgets
36ropsGadget :: (D.CContent c) => [C.Rop c]
37ropsGadget = Rop.ropList "gadget"  -- GROUP
38    --         CONSTRUCTOR       USAGE                      ATTRIBUTE
39    [ Rop.def  consContents      "contents /N"              "-term*"
40    , Rop.def  consDumpTree      "dump-tree X"              "-tree*"
41    , Rop.def  consEqlize        "eqlize"                   ""
42    , Rop.def  consPoDepth       "partial-order-depth /P /P -to /N /N"     "-x -y . -to"
43    , Rop.def  consPoHeight      "partial-order-height /P /P -to /N /N"    "-x -y . -to"
44    , Rop.def  consVisitDistance "visit-distance R -step /P ... -to /N -distance /N"  "-relmap/ . -step -to -distance"
45    , Rop.def  consSize          "size /N"                  "-term"
46    , Rop.def  Rop.consSubtext   "subtext /N E"             "-term -subtext . -trim?"
47    ]
48
49
50-- ----------------------  contents
51
52-- | __contents \/N__
53--
54--   Collect all contents in unary relation.
55--
56consContents :: (Ord c) => C.RopCons c
57consContents med =
58    do n <- Rop.getTerm med "-term"
59       Right $ relmapContents med n
60
61-- | Create @contents@ relmap.
62relmapContents :: (Ord c) => C.Intmed c -> S.TermName -> C.Relmap c
63relmapContents med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitContents
64
65-- | Create @contents@ relkit.
66relkitContents :: (Ord c) => S.TermName -> C.RelkitFlow c
67relkitContents n _ = Right $ C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitFull False kitf where
68    he2  = D.headFrom [n]
69    kitf = map B.li1 . B.unique . concat
70
71
72-- ----------------------  partial-order
73
74--  partial-order-height /x /y -to /z /ht
75--  partial-order-depth /x /y -to /z /dp
76
77-- | __partial-order-height \/P \/P -to \/N \/N__
78consPoHeight :: (Ord c, D.CDec c) => C.RopCons c
79consPoHeight = consPoScale Rop.poScaleHeight
80
81-- | __partial-order-depth \/P \/P -to \/N \/N__
82consPoDepth :: (Ord c, D.CDec c) => C.RopCons c
83consPoDepth = consPoScale Rop.poScaleDepth
84
85consPoScale :: (Ord c, D.CDec c) => Rop.PoScaleCalc c -> C.RopCons c
86consPoScale scale med =
87    do x <- Rop.getTerm med "-x"
88       y <- Rop.getTerm med "-y"
89       (z,r) <- Rop.getTerm2 med "-to"
90       Right $ relmapPoScale scale med (x,y,z,r)
91
92-- | Create @partial-order-height@ or @partial-order-depth@ relmap.
93relmapPoScale :: (Ord c, D.CDec c) => Rop.PoScaleCalc c -> C.Intmed c -> S.TermName4 -> C.Relmap c
94relmapPoScale scale med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitPoScale scale
95
96-- | Create @partial-order-height@ or @partial-order-depth@ relkit.
97relkitPoScale :: (Ord c, D.CDec c) => Rop.PoScaleCalc c -> S.TermName4 -> C.RelkitFlow c
98relkitPoScale _ _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
99relkitPoScale scale (x,y,z,r) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
100    he2         = D.headFrom [z,r]
101    kit2        = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitFull False f2
102    xyPick      = D.picker [x,y] he1
103    f2 bo1      = map put $ scale $ map get bo1
104    get cs      = let [cx,cy] = xyPick cs in (cx,cy)
105    put (cx,i)  = [cx, D.pInt i]
106
107
108-- ----------------------  visit-distance
109
110--  visit-distance r -step /a /b : /c /d -to /v -distance /n
111
112-- | __visit-distance R -step \/P ... -to \/N -distance \/N__
113consVisitDistance :: (Ord c, D.CDec c, D.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
114consVisitDistance med =
115    do rmap  <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
116       to    <- Rop.getTerm   med "-to"
117       dist  <- Rop.getTerm   med "-distance"
118       steps <- Rop.getTermsColon med "-step"
119       case steps of
120         [step1, step2] -> Right $ relmapVisitDistance med (step1, step2, to, dist) rmap
121         _              -> Msg.adlib "Require two sets of terms"
122
123-- | Create @visit-distance@ relmap.
124relmapVisitDistance :: (Ord c, D.CDec c, D.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> ([S.TermName], [S.TermName], S.TermName, S.TermName) -> O.Map (C.Relmap c)
125relmapVisitDistance med = C.relmapBinary med . relkitVisitDistance
126
127-- | Create @visit-distance@ relkit.
128relkitVisitDistance :: (Ord c, D.CDec c, D.CRel c) => ([S.TermName], [S.TermName], S.TermName, S.TermName) -> C.RelkitBinary c
129relkitVisitDistance (step1, step2, to, dist) (C.RelkitOutput he2 kitb2) (Just he1)
130    | D.newTermsExist pkStart   = Msg.unkTerm (D.newTerms pkStart) he1
131    | D.newTermsExist pkFrom    = Msg.unkTerm (D.newTerms pkFrom)  he2
132    | D.newTermsExist pkTo      = Msg.unkTerm (D.newTerms pkTo)    he2
133    | dup      /= []     = Msg.dupAttr dup
134    | newDist  == []     = Msg.adlib "Require new term"
135    | lenFrom  /= lenTo  = Msg.adlib "Require same number of terms"
136    | otherwise          = Right kit3
137    where
138      pkStart   = D.termPicker step1 he1
139      pkDist    = D.termPicker [to]  he1
140      pkFrom    = D.termPicker step1 he2
141      pkTo      = D.termPicker step2 he2
142
143      newDist   = D.ssLSideNames pkDist
144
145      lenFrom   = length step1
146      lenTo     = length step2
147      dup       = B.duplicates $ dist : step1
148      he3       = D.headConsNest to heTo he1
149      heTo      = D.headFrom $ dist : step1
150      kit3      = C.relkitJust he3 $ C.RelkitAbFull False kitf3 [kitb2]
151      kitf3     = relkitVisitDistanceBody (lenFrom == 1) pkStart pkFrom pkTo heTo
152
153relkitVisitDistance _ _ _ = Right C.relkitNothing
154
155relkitVisitDistanceBody :: (D.CDec c, D.CRel c, Ord c) =>
156  Bool -> D.TermPicker c -> D.TermPicker c -> D.TermPicker c -> D.Head -> [C.BodyMap c] -> B.AbMap [[c]]
157relkitVisitDistanceBody optimize1 pkStart pkFrom pkTo heTo
158    | optimize1 = kitf3 (add1, tuple1, vdist1)
159    | otherwise = kitf3 (addN, tupleN, vdistN)
160    where
161      kitf3 x@(addX, _, _) bmaps bo1 =
162          do [bo2] <- calcBody bmaps bo1
163             let vstep = foldr addX Map.empty bo2
164             Right $ calc x vstep `map` bo1
165
166      calc (_, tupleX, vdistX) vstep cs1 = rel : cs1 where
167          rel    = D.pRel $ D.Rel heTo body
168          body   = map tupleX $ Map.assocs $ vdistX vstep start
169          start  = D.ssRShare pkStart cs1
170
171      vdistN vstep cs   = visitDistanceFrom vstep cs
172      vdist1 vstep [c]  = visitDistanceFrom vstep c
173      vdist1 _ _        = B.bug "visit-distance"
174
175      tupleN (cs, n)    = D.pInt n : cs
176      tuple1 (c, n)     = [D.pInt n, c]
177
178      addN cs           = insertPush (D.ssRShare pkFrom cs)
179                                     (D.ssRShare pkTo cs)
180      add1 cs           = insertPush (head $ D.ssRShare pkFrom cs)
181                                     (head $ D.ssRShare pkTo cs)
182
183calcBody :: [C.BodyMap c] -> [[c]] -> B.Ab [[[c]]]
184calcBody bmaps bo = (\bmap -> bmap bo) `mapM` bmaps
185
186-- | Mapping node to next nodes.
187type VisitStep a = Map.Map a [a]
188
189-- | Mapping node to its distance.
190type VisitDist a = Map.Map a Int
191
192visitDistanceFrom :: (Ord a) => VisitStep a -> a -> VisitDist a
193visitDistanceFrom step a = visitDistance step $ Map.fromList [(a, 0)]
194
195visitDistance :: (Ord a) => VisitStep a -> VisitDist a -> VisitDist a
196visitDistance step = visit 1 where
197    sameSize x y = Map.size x == Map.size y
198    visit n dist = case visitDistanceStep step dist n of
199                     dist' | sameSize dist dist' -> dist'
200                           | otherwise           -> visit (n + 1) dist'
201
202visitDistanceStep :: (Ord a) => VisitStep a -> VisitDist a -> Int -> VisitDist a
203visitDistanceStep step dist n = foldr insert dist toList where
204    insert a  = insertFirst a n
205    toList    = next $ Map.keys dist
206    next      = concat . B.mapMaybe (`Map.lookup` step)
207
208insertFirst :: (Ord k) => k -> a -> Map.Map k a -> Map.Map k a
209insertFirst = Map.insertWith first where
210    first _ old = old
211
212insertPush :: (Ord k) => k -> a -> O.Map (Map.Map k [a])
213insertPush k a = Map.insertWith push k [a] where
214    push _ as = a : as
215
216
217-- ----------------------  size
218
219-- | __size \/N__
220--
221--  Count number of tuples.
222--
223consSize :: (D.CDec c) => C.RopCons c
224consSize med =
225  do n <- Rop.getTerm med "-term"
226     Right $ relmapSize med n
227
228-- | Create @size@ relmap.
229relmapSize :: (D.CDec c) => C.Intmed c -> S.TermName -> C.Relmap c
230relmapSize med n = C.relmapFlow med $ relkitSize n
231
232-- | Create @size@ relkit.
233relkitSize :: (D.CDec c) => S.TermName -> C.RelkitFlow c
234relkitSize n _ = Right kit2 where
235    he2       = D.headFrom [n]
236    kit2      = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitFull False kitf2
237    kitf2 bo1 = [[ D.pInt $ length bo1 ]]
238
239
240-- ----------------------  eqlize
241
242-- | __eqlize__
243consEqlize :: (Ord c) => C.RopCons c
244consEqlize med = Right $ relmapEqlize med
245
246-- | Create @eqlize@ relmap.
247relmapEqlize :: (Ord c) => C.Intmed c -> C.Relmap c
248relmapEqlize med = C.relmapFlow med relkitEqlize
249
250-- | Create @eqlize@ relkit.
251relkitEqlize :: (Ord c) => C.RelkitFlow c
252relkitEqlize Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
253relkitEqlize (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
254    kit2       = C.relkitJust he1 $ C.RelkitFull False kitf2
255    kitf2 bo1  = case eqlizeBody Map.empty bo1 of
256                   (_, bo2) -> bo2
257
258eqlize :: (Ord c) => Map.Map c c -> c -> (Map.Map c c, c)
259eqlize m c = case Map.lookup c m of
260               Just c' -> (m, c')
261               Nothing -> (Map.insert c c m, c)
262
263eqlizeList :: (Ord c) => Map.Map c c -> [c] -> (Map.Map c c, [c])
264eqlizeList = loop where
265    loop m [] = (m, [])
266    loop m (c : cs) = let (m1, c')  = eqlize m c
267                          (m2, cs') = loop m1 cs
268                      in (m2, c' : cs')
269
270eqlizeBody :: (Ord c) => Map.Map c c -> [[c]] -> (Map.Map c c, [[c]])
271eqlizeBody = loop where
272    loop m [] = (m, [])
273    loop m (t : ts) = let (m1, t')  = eqlizeList m t
274                          (m2, ts') = loop m1 ts
275                      in (m2, t' : ts')
276
277
278-- ----------------------  dump-tree
279
280-- | __dump-tree E__
281consDumpTree :: (D.CDec c) => C.RopCons c
282consDumpTree med =
283  do trees <- Rop.getTrees med "-tree"
284     Msg.dumpTrees trees
285
